text: Venus Ramey (September 26, 1924 â€“ June 17, 2017) was an American beauty pageant contest, and later an activist. She won the Miss America competition in 1944. She was born in Ashland, Kentucky. Ramey left Kentucky to work for the war effort in Washington, D.C., and won the Miss District of Columbia pageant and then became Miss America in 1944. She was the first red-haired contestant to win the title. Ramey died on June 17, 2017 in Science Hill, Kentucky at the age of 92.Venus Ramey | 1924 - 2017 | Obituary ==References== Category:1924 births Category:2017 deaths Category:American activists Category:Models from Kentucky Category:People from Ashland, Kentucky
title: Venus Ramey
